product_overview: PDF AUTO is a professional batch PDF converter web application designed to convert Excel files into PDFs efficiently with a user-friendly interface and smooth navigation.
core_goals: Provide a seamless and visually consistent user interface across devices including mobile and tablets.
Ensure accessibility standards with descriptive alt texts and keyboard navigation support.
Optimize media assets to improve load performance and responsiveness.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date links and metadata for SEO and user navigation.
Offer clear user guidance with a usage guide and easy access to download and support resources.
key_features: Landing page with major content sections: Navbar, Hero Banner with version badge, Features grid, Visual Usage Guide, and Footer.
Responsive navigation bar adapting between mobile (with menu accessibility) and desktop views.
Grid layouts for features and usage steps with responsive column adjustments for different screen sizes.
Image assets for app screenshots and usage steps with optimized loading strategies.
Smooth scrolling behavior for in-page navigation links with scroll-padding to prevent navbar overlap.
External link integration including download button linking to GitHub releases and footer support links.
Hardcoded version constants moved to a central constants file for consistent updates.
SEO improvements including updated page title, meta description, and favicon replacement.
user_flow_summary: User lands on the Main Landing Page and views the Hero section with the app name and version.
User navigates using the Navbar with access to Features, Usage Guide, and Download links, available on all screen sizes.
User explores Features section displayed in a responsive grid layout.
User scrolls to the Visual Usage Guide section supported by descriptive screenshots with optimized loading.
User clicks the Download button to access the latest releases on GitHub.
User can find support/contact information in the Footer with appropriate linking.
Smooth scroll navigation ensures quick and visually pleasing transitions without content overlap.
validation_criteria: Verify Navbar responsiveness and accessibility on mobile devices, ensuring hidden buttons are accessible via hamburger menu or alternatives.
Confirm the hero text wraps correctly on tablet screen widths without awkward breaks.
Check grid layouts on various screen widths (600px-768px and others) for appropriate column distribution and alignment, especially with uneven item counts.
Audit image asset paths and load performance, ensuring no 404 errors and optimized file sizes (preferably under 500KB).
Validate alt texts on all images for descriptive accessibility.
Test smooth scrolling links including scroll-padding to avoid navbar overlay on section headings.
Test all external links for correctness, especially the download button's GitHub URL and footer support links.
Ensure all hardcoded version strings are sourced from a single constant file and update all occurrences accordingly.
Confirm SEO elements such as <title>, <meta name="description">, and favicon are correctly set in the HTML head.
Run Lighthouse audits targeting Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) and identify opportunities to improve page speed through image loading strategies like lazy loading for below-the-fold visuals.
